starvationevasion.sim

Class CardDeck

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.sim.CardDeck

  • public class CardDeck
extends java.lang.Object
    Each player region as a unique collection of 80 policy cards that make up that player's deck.

    Each player's deck is shuffled at the start of the simulation. The deck is an ordered collection.

    There is no add() method because a card can never be added to a deck.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CardDeck(EnumRegion playerRegion)
      Each player region has a unique deck to be read from .cvs file: playerRegion(String), card(String), count(int).

      In future versions, players will be able to produce and save custom decks.

      In this pre-test version, cards are just randomly picked with no difference for different player regions.

      EnumPolicy[] drawCards()
      Returns an array of cards drawn from the top of the deck so that the player who own's this deck has a total of 7 cards in hand.

      If there are insufficient cards remaining, then the player's discard pile is shuffled back into the deck.

    • Field Detail

      • CARDS_IN_PLAYER_DECK

        public static final int CARDS_IN_PLAYER_DECK
        Each player starts with a unique deck of cards. A deck will, in general, contain duplicate cards. If the player needs to draw a card and his, her or its deck is empty then the player's discard is shuffled back into the deck.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        private java.util.ArrayList<EnumPolicy> drawPile

      • CardDeck

        public CardDeck(EnumRegion playerRegion)
        Each player region has a unique deck to be read from .cvs file: playerRegion(String), card(String), count(int).

        In future versions, players will be able to produce and save custom decks.

        In this pre-test version, cards are just randomly picked with no difference for different player regions.

    • Method Detail

      • shuffle

        private void shuffle()
        Shuffles the deck of cards.

      • drawCards

        public EnumPolicy[] drawCards()
        Returns an array of cards drawn from the top of the deck so that the player who own's this deck has a total of 7 cards in hand.

        If there are insufficient cards remaining, then the player's discard pile is shuffled back into the deck.
        Returns:
        The cards drawn from the deck. Returns null if the player already has a max hand size.

      • discard

        public void discard(EnumPolicy card)

      • cardsRemainingInDrawPile

        public int cardsRemainingInDrawPile()
        Returns:
        The number of cards remaining in the draw pile.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This entry point is for testing only.

        This test shows how to create playerDeck and draw the first hand.
        Parameters:
        args - ignored.
